Try downloading the latest jUnit, which is 3.8.1 from junit.org.
Then at least put the junit.jar in your Project's CLASSPATH in your 
Project Properties.
Even better, go to your Project Properties, create a library from the 
Libraries, Add, Configure buttons called "junit 3.8.1".
Then in the sourcepath, add the src.jar.
In the classpath, add the junit.jar.
In the javadoc path, add the javadocs directory.
Then select the library you just created to add to your project.  This 
will auto-add the above to your classpath, sourcepath, and javadoc path 
respectively.  You can then reuse this in other IntelliJ projects.
This will allow you to browse the junit source and get junit javadoc 
when needed.

Let me know if that fixes it for you.

Louie

junitj wrote:

> I have a problem when I tried to use asserEquals methos inside my 
> test case, I got the error :

> (Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)V"
> 
> I tried to remove the junit.jar from the IDE (Intellij) and reload 
> it, sometimes it works and sometimes the error return back.
> 
> thanks in advance
